intro: Introduced by Loran Schmit, 23rd District; Willard H. Waldo, 31st District
title: AN ACT to adopt the Environmental Protection Act; to provide an operative date; to repeal sections 71-3001 to 71-3012, Reissue Revised Statutes of Nebraska, 1943, and amendments thereto, sections 28-1035 to 28-1039, sections 71-4101 to 71-4109, and sections 71-4501 to 71-4521, Revised Statutes Supplement, 1969; and to declare an emergency.
enactingClause: Be it enacted by the People of the State of Nebraska,

text.chapeau: Whereas the water, land and air of this state are among its most precious resources and the welfare of each person, and the public in general, in this state; and whereas pollution of these resources in this state is likewise a concern in adjoining states, the public policy of this state is hereby declared to be:

subsection.content: To conserve the water in this state and to protect and improve the quality of water for human consumption, wildlife, fish and other aquatic life industry, recreation and other productive, beneficial uses;
